newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Japan to give Romania loans for transport projects.
newsitem.headline: Japan to give Romania loans for transport projects.

text.p: Japan has pledged to grant Romania two loans worth a combined 21.989 billion yen ($177 million) to fund transport projects, the Japan embassy in Bucharest said on Tuesday.
An embassy statement said the loans were intended for a Black Sea port container terminal project and a road rehabilitation project.
It said "Romania and Japan will negotiate in the future the terms of the signing of the exchange of verbal notes", without elaborating.
Romania's Foreign Ministry said in a statement the total 30-year loan, with a 10-year grace period, would bear 2.7 percent interest.
